New Records: Erling Haaland became Norway's all-time top goalscorer.
Pre-Game Insights: Austria have scored six goals in their first three Nations League matches, averaging two goals per game.
Norway have conceded three goals in three of their last six away matches, highlighting their vulnerability on the road.
Erling Haaland has averaged 0.94 goals per game for Norway, making him the primary threat to Austria’s defence.
Austria’s recent demolition of Kazakhstan, where they scored four goals, has bolstered their confidence.
Austria have struggled against Norway in recent meetings, winning just once in their last four encounters.
Austria’s high possession stats (61.7%) demonstrate their ability to control the tempo and keep the pressure on their opponents.
Austria’s midfield creativity, spearheaded by Marcel Sabitzer and Christoph Baumgartner, ensures they will likely break through the Norwegian defence.
Norway’s inconsistency on the road and the absence of their influential captain Martin Ødegaard might leave them exposed at the back.
